sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"让，允许"之意。
means: allow ：普通用词，侧重听任、默许或不加阻止。在正式场合可用来表客气的请求。
let ：常用词，用于各种非正式场合，语气最弱，指允许或无力阻止某事，暗示漠不关心或听之任之。
permit ：正式用词，在多数场合可与allow换用，语义最强，指准许某人做某事，含权威或正式的意味。
authorize ：语气最强，指权威性的允许与认可。

sentence.Network_en: They will not allow your more way-out ideas to pass unchallenged.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不会放过你这些古怪的念头的。

sentence.Network_en: Police warned motorists to allow extra time to get to work.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方告诫驾车者出门上班要留出富余时间。

sentence.Network_en: Why should a successful company allow another firm to pick its brains?
sentence.Network_cn: 为什么一个成功的企业就得允许别的公司来讨教呢？

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (originally in the senses 'commend, sanction' and 'assign as a right'): from Old French alouer, from Latin allaudare 'to praise', reinforced by medieval Latin allocare 'to place' (see allocate)

entry.def: If someone is allowed to do something, it is all right for them to do it and they will not get into trouble.

example.ex: The children are not allowed to watch violent TV programmes...
example.tran: 儿童不准收看含暴力内容的电视节目。

example.ex: The Government will allow them to advertise on radio and television...
example.tran: 政府将准许他们在广播和电视上做广告。

entry.def: If you are allowed something, you are given permission to have it or are given it.

example.ex: Gifts like chocolates or flowers are allowed...
example.tran: 巧克力、鲜花等礼物在允许之列。

example.ex: He should be allowed the occasional treat.
example.tran: 应该准许他偶尔也轻松一下。

entry.def: If you allow something to happen, you do not prevent it.

example.ex: He won't allow himself to fail...
example.tran: 他不会任由自己失败的。

example.ex: If the soil is allowed to dry out the tree could die.
example.tran: 如果听任土壤变干，树木可能会枯死。

entry.def: If one thing allows another thing to happen, the first thing creates the opportunity for the second thing to happen.

example.ex: The compromise will allow him to continue his free market reforms.
example.tran: 妥协将使他得以继续他的自由市场改革。

example.ex: ...an attempt to allow the Moslem majority a greater share of power...
example.tran: 使穆斯林多数派拥有更大权力的尝试

entry.def: If you allow a particular length of time or a particular amount of something for a particular purpose, you include it in your planning.

example.ex: Allow about 75ml (3fl oz) per six servings.
example.tran: 每6份酌加约75毫升(3液盎司)。

entry.def: If you allow that something is true, you admit or agree that it is true.

example.ex: Warren also allows that capitalist development may, in its early stages, result in increased social inequality.
example.tran: 沃伦也承认资本主义发展初级阶段可能会导致社会不平等现象加剧。

entry.tran: 请允许我（用以礼貌地表示为某人提供服务）
entry.def: Some people say 'Allow me' as a polite way of offering to do something for someone.

example.ex: Allow me to buy you a drink at the bar.

entry.tran: 请允许我（用以引出要说的话）
entry.def: Some people use Allow me to... as a way of introducing something that they want to say or do.

example.ex: Allow me to introduce Dr Amberg.
example.tran: 请允许我介绍安伯格博士。

means.word_mean: 1. make it possible through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen;

sentences.sentence: "This permits the water to rush in"
"This sealed door won't allow the water come into the basement"
"This will permit the rain to run off"
"She permitted her son to visit her estranged husband"
"I won't let the police search her basement"
"I cannot allow you to see your exam"
"grant permission"
"Mandela was allowed few visitors in prison"

means.word_mean: 4. give or assign a share of money or time to a particular person or cause;

sentences.sentence: "I will earmark this money for your research"

means.word_mean: 5. make a possibility or provide opportunity for; permit to be attainable or cause to remain;

sentences.sentence: "This leaves no room for improvement"
"The evidence allows only one conclusion"
"allow for mistakes"
"leave lots of time for the trip"
"This procedure provides for lots of leeway"

means.word_mean: 6. allow or plan for a certain possibility; concede the truth or validity of something;

sentences.sentence: "I allow for this possibility"
"The seamstress planned for 5% shrinkage after the first wash"
"This problem admits of no solution"
"This short story allows of several different interpretations"

means.word_mean: 8. allow the other (baseball) team to score;

sentences.sentence: "give up a run"

means.word_mean: 9. grant as a discount or in exchange;

sentences.sentence: "The camera store owner allowed me $50 on my old camera"

means.word_mean: 10. allow the presence of or allow (an activity) without opposing or prohibiting;

sentences.sentence: "We don't allow dogs here"
"Children are not permitted beyond this point"
"We cannot tolerate smoking in the hospital"

auth_sentence.content: What does the new homepage allow me to do?
auth_sentence.res_content: What does the new homepage allow me to do?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What does the new homepage allow me to do?

auth_sentence.content: Stir in the remaining alcohol and allow to cool.
auth_sentence.res_content: Stir in the remaining alcohol and allow to cool.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Stir in the remaining alcohol and allow to cool.

auth_sentence.content: They allow us to tailor our websites to you.
auth_sentence.res_content: They allow us to tailor our websites to you.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They allow us to tailor our websites to you.

Sentence.sentence: It allows for economic efficiency, and when we buy things from places that have lower production costs than we do, we benefit.
In general, you will want to do strength training two or three days a week, allowing recovery days between sessions.
The big change is the availability of more data about people and things, which allows physical assets to be divided and consumed as services.

sentences.en: I don't think he would allow it.
Do they allow smoking in the cinemas?
sentences.cn: 他们允许在电影院里抽烟吗?

sentences.en: Allow me to introduce you to our headmaster.
sentences.cn: 请允许我介绍你见见我们的校长。

sentences.en: The court allowed a sum of money to each child for clothing.
sentences.cn: 法院判给每个孩子一笔服装费。

sentences.en: The referee refused to allow the goal.
You must allow yourself to be wrong.
Jack had allowed himself to become fat.

means.word_mean: 容许某事发生(或存在)；容许(常与of连用)

sentences.en: a premise that allow of only one conclusion
sentences.cn: 假设容许只有一个结论

jushi.english: Only a few journalists were allowed inside.
jushi.chinese: 只有几个新闻记者获准进入会场。

jushi.english: I don't think he would allow it.
We will never allow such a recurrence of that historical tragedy.
jushi.chinese: 我们绝不许可这样的历史悲剧重演。
